summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling previous relevant resolutions, 

1. Decides to continue the provisions of resolution 986 (1995), except for paragraphs 4, 11 and 12, for a new 150-day period starting 4 July 2001, to address humanitarian needs in Iraq.

2. Allocates funds from petroleum and petroleum products imports for food/nutrition and health sectors, with 13% for purposes referred to in paragraph 8 (b) of resolution 986 (1995).

3. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure effective implementation, enhance UN observation in Iraq, and assure equitable distribution of goods.

4. Decides to review implementation after 90 days and before the 150-day period ends, intending to renew provisions if satisfactorily implemented.

5. Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation after 90 days and before the 150-day period ends.

6. Requests the Committee established by resolution 661 (1990) to report on implementation.

7. Allows up to $600 million for expenses from contracts approved in 1998 and 1999.

8. Requests the Secretary-General to transfer excess funds for humanitarian purchases.

9. Sets the effective deduction rate for the Compensation Fund at 25%, with additional funds for humanitarian projects for vulnerable groups in Iraq.
The Security Council:
- Requests the Secretary-General to report on the use of funds in his reports 
- Expresses intention to review effective deduction rate of funds deposited in escrow account 
- Urges all States, particularly Iraq, to cooperate in implementing this resolution;
- Calls on Iraq to implement paragraph 27 of resolution 1284 (1999) 
- Requests Secretary-General to review Iraq's progress in implementing these measures;
- Stresses need to ensure security and safety of persons involved in implementation;
- Appeals to States to cooperate in submitting applications and issuing export licences 
- Decides to remain seized of the matter.
